title: "What is the connection between biology, psychology and trauma? How do interruptions affect our sense of self?"
first_phrase: In this text, Rolf explains how the interruptions in the alignment between the sun and the earth can create psychology, resulting in a subjective biological experience of separation-merger. The interruptions cause chaos leading to trauma, leading to the formation of ideas and body images which distract and explain the pain. The biological core, which has no ideas or psychological interruptions, is essential to understand to appreciate the Tao. In the last part, Wilhelm Reich's concept of "vegetative" is discussed in this context.

last_phrase: In conclusion, understanding the relationship between psychology and biology is crucial in dealing with trauma and its effects on our beingness. Developing awareness of the interruptions in our biological core and the resultant psychological responses can lead to a deeper understanding of ourselves and the creation of a separate sense of self. By addressing past traumas and breaking free from identifying with past body images, we can move towards a healthier and more integrated state of being.
